tree_elements.text: To the Editor: Sidd Shetty, Aditi Kamal and Melvina Deb

In your article, you suggested seven approaches to the problem of increasing school-related stress during the pandemic. I would like to suggest an eighth one: a constant movement break with music to stay away from the screen.  Staring at screens for hours creates a lot of stress on the eyes, back and knees. During these unprecedented times, it is important to stay away from screens to release stress. A constant movement break with music is a way to motivate the physical break with the rhythm of music. Music can really help to make the movement break fun and relieve stress. For example, by taking a five-minute break of moving with music after two hours of study, one can recharge and refocus. It not only helps one feel good mentally but also physically.
